title: Artificial Intelligence and Financial Security: The New Challenge of Digital Banking
description: The digital transformation of the financial system is no longer a trend—it is a reality that continues to advance rapidly. In this new digital era, banks and fintech companies face the challenge of innovating without losing sight of security. Every transaction, every piece of data, and every user form part of an environment where trust […]

title: America's Coming Resource Crunch
description: The United States is facing a collision of two crises: China's tightening control over the minerals that fuel modern industry and America's exploding electricity demand from artificial intelligence.
content: The United States is facing a collision of two crises: China's tightening control over the minerals that fuel modern industry and America's exploding electricity demand from artificial intelligence. One is geopolitical, the other domestic, yet togeth... [8174 chars]

title: The lecturers learning to spot AI misconduct
description: With more students using artificial intelligence (AI), academics are being trained to spot wrongful use.
content:

Ellis MaddisonLeicester
With the rise of artificial intelligence (AI) and more students turning to technology in their studies, academics have a complex challenge on their hands.

title: UAE: Bin Bayyah calls for establishment of global ethical framework for AI
description: Sheikh Abdallah Bin Bayyah, , Chairman of the UAE Council for Fatwa and President of the Abu Dhabi Forum for Peace, called for the establishment of a global ethical framework for artificial intelligence (AI) that brings together religious, intellectual, and scientific leaders, as well as technical experts and policymakers. The aim, he emphasised, is to guide the trajectory of emerging technologies to serve humanity, uphold human dignity, and promote global peace.
content: Dubai [UAE], October 20 (ANI/WAM): Sheikh Abdallah Bin Bayyah, , Chairman of the UAE Council for Fatwa and President of the Abu Dhabi Forum for Peace, called for the establishment of a global ethical framework for artificial intelligence (AI) that br... [2634 chars]

title: Artificial intelligence chatbots replacing India’s call-centre workers
description: ‘All IT services will be replaced in the next five years ... it’s going to be pretty chaotic’
content:
At a start-up office in this Indian city, developers are fine-tuning artificial-intelligence (AI) chatbots that talk and message like humans.
The company, LimeChat, has an audacious goal: to make customer-service jobs almost obsolete. It says its gen... [10939 chars]

title: Can a machine be truly creative? Let’s ask AARON
description: Artist Harold Cohen created the AI artist AARON in the 1970s–and kicked off a debate about the creative output of artificial intelligence systems
content: Harold Cohen didn’t fit the mold of an AI pioneer. He wasn’t a computer scientist. He wasn’t a programmer. He was an artist – brilliant, world-renowned, and celebrated for his explosive use of color and bold compositions. In 1966, he represented Brit... [4086 chars]

title: OpenAI big chip orders dwarf its revenues - for now
description: OpenAI is ordering hundreds of billions of dollars worth of chips in the artificial intelligence race, raising questions among investors about how the startup will finance these purchases. "They will need hundreds of billions of dollars to live up to their obligations," said Gil Luria, managing director at D.A. Davidson, a financial consulting firm.

title: UPDATE 1-South Korea seeks to become 4th-largest global defence power, President Lee says
description: Lee was speaking at South Korea's largest-ever arms fair, the Seoul International Aerospace & Defense Exhibition (ADEX) 2025, where firms showed off new unmanned and artificial intelligence-enhanced weapons from howitzers to suicide drones in pursuit of more global defence sales. South Korea ranked 10th in arms sales as of 2023, according to data from Stockholm International Peace Research Institute's (SIPRI) top 100 arms companies data.
content: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung said on Monday the country will devote a "larger-than-expected budget" in defence and aerospace research until 2030 as it seeks to build the world's fourth-largest defence industry. Lee was speaking at South Korea... [1254 chars]
